intro: Plantago bridgesii var. angustifolia, commonly known as narrowleaf plantain, is a perennial herb native to parts of North America. It features a basal rosette of lanceolate, hairless leaves that are typically 2–8 inches long. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers in dense spikes during the summer months. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in fields, roadsides, and along streambanks. Its medicinal properties have been historically used for their soothing effects on skin irritations and respiratory conditions.
